The claim made by Rep: Peter King, R-N.Y., is that U.S. government officials have a pattern of looking into individuals who later become terrorists without stopping them.
The claim is supported by the acknowledg: the older brother of Dzokhar Tsarnaev, at the request of Russian officials in 2011. The FBI found no ties to terror after examining his phone records, websites he visited, and associates.
Rep: Peter King, a senior Republican on the House Homeland Security Committee and the House Intelligence Committee, stated in an interview that the pattern described in the claim sounded familiar to him.
The claim is further supported by four p: Peter King's office: Anwar al-Awlaki, David Headley, Abdulhakim Muhammed, and Nidal Hasan. These individuals were all brought to the attention of the FBI, examined, and deemed no threat before carrying out terrorist acts.
